heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 06 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (182°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 52.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 2.2°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 9%) and rainfall (up 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 884 m), light levels (up 10711 lux), and pressure (up 9 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.4 mm), light levels (up 9500 lux), and cloud levels (up 1015 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 884.5m lower than yesterday, 196.6m lower than the past week, 1015.3m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 737m to 4780m and averaged 1509.2m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, the air will feel noticeably humid and uncomfortable and calm and still conditions are expected. Chance of light rain, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and bright intervals likely. Weather could become unsettled.
